data.title: Great French & Italian Hits
data.meta_description: Full track listing and details of the Vinyl Album: Connie Francis - Great French & Italian Hits (1978), on 45worlds.
data.text:
confranfan SUBS

13th Jul 2017

OLYGRAM INC release

POLYDOR label

This is an original compilation first released to be marketed in Canada following the company name change locally from Polydor Ltd to PolyGram Inc.

A1: DANKE SCHON [French version]

A2: PERSONNE AU MONDE [No Arms Can Ever Hold You - French version]

A5: JE SAIS QU'UN GARS [Where The Boys Are - French version]

A6: L'HIVER SERA LONG POUR MOI SANS TOI [Blue Winter - French version]

A7: JAMAIS [Your Love / La Paloma - French version]

B1: WHAT NOW MY LOVE? [Et Maintenant - Second recording]

B2: THIS IS MY SONG [Cara Felicita]

B3: IL MIO AMORE E COSI [Et Si C'Etait Vrai / All The Love In The World - Italian version]

B7: LA PALOMA [Your Love - Italian version]

Simultaneously issued on

- cassette POLYDOR P460 453

- cartridge POLYDOR P860 453

Three titles made their release debut on this album:

A2: NO ARMS CAN EVER HOLD YOU was first released in 1962 via an Italian & English version of NESSUNO AL MONDO recorded in October of that year. Almost a year earlier, on November 9th, 1961, Connie recorded an Italian only version. The French version, PERSONNE AU MONDE, had been cut one week before on November 2, 1961.

A6: L'HIVER SERA LONG POUR MOI SANS TOI remained, until the above release, the only foreign language version of BLUE WINTER awaiting release. All other versions had been recorded and released in 1964.

B3: IL MIO AMORE E COSI was recorded in 1966, presumably in October but unconfirmed. An Italian only interpretation of ALL THE LOVE IN THE WORLD, it has an entirely different production and arrangement to the English version. The song is a French original titled ET SI C'ETAIT VRAI, but has not been recorded by Connie in that language.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------B2: THIS IS MY SONG [CARA FELICITA] the 'live' 1970 Romanian concert track first featured on LAURIE HOUSE LH-8019 CONNIE ITALIANO, was leased to PolyGram for this recording. All rights are owned by Connie Francis.

Added composer credit / public domain notations.
